Entries.default: A familiar presence pushes against the boundaries of your mind.

"How rare a thing it is, a kith who does as they're commanded."

Behind his words hangs the profound silence of a forest blanketed in deep snow.
"Is the machine intact? The ruins collapsed on it."
"I stuck my neck out for you. Where's my reward?"
"The machine was unharmed - and will now remain so, thanks to your efforts." A genuine warm colors Galawain's words.
"True loyalty requires a strength most lack, and you have proved yourself to be strong indeed, Herald of Berath."
"It is your actions that please me, not your intentions."
"Take now my blessing, Watcher, and see with the keen eyes of beasts."

"How bold you are to speak to your god thus. I must commend your bravery and warn you, too - do not overstep.

"You will not be Berath's creature forever."

"How bold you are to speak to your god thus. I must commend your bravery and warn you, too - do not overstep.

"You will not be Berath's creature forever."
Galawain pauses, letting his words hang in the air.
Galawain pauses, letting his words hang in the air.
The presence leaves as swiftly as it came.
